At Auctim, they auction all sorts of things, from office chairs to industrial grinders, cars, and artworks.
When they want to auction these lots, they need to be described.

Currently, they take photos and manually type all the descriptions into an Excel file.
The photos are then renamed to the lot number and photo number and uploaded, along with an Excel file containing the corresponding numbers, to our ERP system.
The ERP system automatically translates the photos and posts them on their website.

The biggest time savings they could achieve would be if they no longer had to type out the descriptions (or at least some of them) but could simply have them recognized.
To get this data into their ERP system, they have a category (e.g., passenger cars) with several mandatory fields, and some that are optional.

They envision this process being asynchronous, with the auction expert first taking the photos. These are sent to the backend, where they invoke an AI service that describes them according to the specifications.
